content.description: Start by jamming a thin hand crack at a lower column, then scramble up a section of broken rock band to the base of the intimidating dihedral. Place some gear and fire the overhanging rimrock on good jams and jugs, the exposure the incredible! Walk off or rap on a bolt + nut.
content.location: On the right side of Arrington Columns, just uphill from Shakespeare Cliff. A wide looking crack that splits the roof is obvious. Climb the clean crack directly below that line.

content.description: One of the best off widths in the gorge. Short and stout.
content.location: Just to the right of Master Looney. The obvious clean OW

content.description: This unusual Lower Gorge route starts with a 10b crack broken up with horizontal seams leading to a rest in a "cave" inset.  From here you clip a bolt and then launch into strenuous roof moves leading to the top.
content.protection: Gear to 2 1/2 inches.  One bolt protecting the roof, with additional optional gear placements possible above this.
content.location: Arrington Columns (North side of the Crooked River)

content.description:
A rare "Two Pitch Climb" in the Lower gorge.  Climb a finger crack to a huge ledge with anchors 5.10b.  Then climb up and right through a steepening and awkward roof crux 5.10c.   

  Finish at the master loony anchors.
content.location: Two lines left of Master Loony.  Can climb the 1st line left of master loony(Chimney Sweep 5.7) if you're looking for an easier pitch 1.

content.description: Ascends a double crack to a good shelf, then follow the last few feet of Off Tempo to the anchor.
content.protection: Standard trad rack with a bolted anchor.
content.location: Double crack immediately right if "Off Tempo"

content.description: Climb a short finger crack to a brief off-finger/thin hand crux at mid height. Jam your way up to a big ledge with a rap anchor to the right, or continue up the rimrock dihedral (may require walk off). Watch out for loose rocks on the ledge.
content.location: Just to the right of Off Tempo, a few feet right of a rectangular 10-foot block. The short thin crack is the most attractive line in this section of the crag.

content.description: A somewhat generic and unexciting group of columns just past the Hand Job Wall.  There are a couple of decent 2 pitch routes here.
